snippet: President Hugo Chávez can be sworn in after the start of his new term, which is set by the Constitution for Jan. 10, Vice President Nicolás Maduro said Friday night.
abstract: Venezuela's Vice Pres Nicolas Maduro says country's Constitution allows Pres Hugo Chavez to be sworn in after the start of his new term; it is clearest indication yet of how government plans to handle likely possibility that Chavez will be delayed in returning from Cuba, where he had cancer surgery and is said to be gravely ill.
lead_paragraph: President Hugo Chávez can be sworn in after the start of his new term, which is set by the Constitution for Jan. 10, Vice President Nicolás Maduro said Friday night.

headline.seo: Venezuela: Constitution Said to Permit Chávez to Take Oath After Term Starts
headline.main: Venezuela: Constitution Said to Permit Chávez to Take Oath After Term Starts
headline.print_headline: Venezuela: Constitution Said to Permit Chávez to Take Oath After Term Starts
